description: The IAR segment is used to transmit a single reaction and information associated with this single reaction occurrence for a particular patient allergy (IAM – patient adverse reaction).

1.name: Allergy Reaction Code
1.description: This field identifies the specific allergic reaction that was documented. This element may conform to some external, standard coding system, or it may conform to local, largely textual or mnemonic descriptions (e.g., convulsions, sneeze, rash, etc.).

2.name: Allergy Severity Code
2.description: This field indicates the general severity of the allergy. Refer to User-defined Table 0128 - Allergy severity code for suggested values.

3.name: Sensitivity To Causative Agent Code
3.description: This field contains the reason why the patient should not be exposed to a substance. Refer to User-defined Table 0436 - Sensitivity to causative Agent code for suggested values.

4.name: Management
4.description: This field contains a textual description of the actions that were performed in response to the reaction.
